title: Me acting surprised when Riot buffs a broken champion

embed.description: Oh my god wow. This is a clip from the original movie called azonto ghost. IG: aboynamedtoni Snapchat: aboynamedtoni. Twitch.tv/snoosnooo

replies.body: Is this a general comment, or did Riot do something really weird on the PBE like give Akali's shroud resistances w/o first removing the 'true'-stealth?
dont give them ideas

> [{quoted}](name=Glaricion,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-10-22T21:27:17.891+0000)
>
> Is this a general comment, or did Riot do something really weird on the PBE like give Akali's shroud resistances w/o first removing the 'true'-stealth?

Hey is probably referring to the Zoe buffs
If you're talking about Zoe, she honestly is kinda weak right now. She's always frustrating to play just because the way her kit was made, but shes significantly weaker than most midlaners currently.

> [{quoted}](name=cute egirl janna,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-22T23:23:49.074+0000)
>
> If you're talking about Zoe, she honestly is kinda weak right now. She's always frustrating to play just because the way her kit was made, but shes significantly weaker than most midlaners currently.

She's cancer and needs to be in the gutter to not spread tumors all over the rift.

> [{quoted}](name=Blåbæret,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-10-22T23:50:18.419+0000)
>
> She's cancer and needs to be in the gutter to not spread tumors all over the rift.

I think kai sa is more deserving

> [{quoted}](name=Blåbæret,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-10-22T23:50:18.419+0000)
>
> She's cancer and needs to be in the gutter to not spread tumors all over the rift.

Ok, why not gut this then. {{champion:99}} {{champion:145}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:84}} 

By your fucking logic, all of those champions are Broken and cancer. Most of them can burst you from 1 to 0, can roam like Appolo, and will be a pain in the ass to deal with, some better than others.

Zoe is the least broken burst champion out of all of them I have listed. At least with Zoe, you need to know what you are doing.

So tell us again, how is Zoe worse than ANY of the 22 champions listed? Three good answers for all of them. Else you are full of hate and talk, no substance.

lux's only problem is her E being impossible to dodge if you are in the area of effect but she is otherwise not really unfair to play against

I don't know why they updated chogath in the first place

brand is a weird case

anivia?  why anivia?  she has NEVER been unfair even if her winrate was high.  She's not very popular, has a very slow moving skill shot and her ultimate is a delayed damage over time ramp up...  Even after her update, it doesn't seem that bad

Nocturne had been in the gutter almost his entire existence once they actually balanced him, realizing that a gank that could not be countered was unhealthy (balance team before late season 5)

ezreal?  he's annoying, but he's really not that bad.  If anything, he's probably healthier than other marksmen because if you catch him, he's dead instead of it being a toss up with the others

evelynn, can't comment on her new kit

graves, yeah, they need to make it where he doesn't knock-back monsters or something because you should not be able to leave the jungle at full health unless you have a dedicated mechanic specifically about healing...

lee sin, i'm not sure how he works in this meta.  previously his problem was that they introduced ward hopping, giving him almost unlimited mobility if the person was good enough

wukong?  i'm not sure what his problem is.  It's more the items and runes that are bad because they give him too much damage

shaco?  shaco has always been annoying but never really unfair to play against or frustrating.  dunno about his latest update

gragas:  simple answer, they gave him too much power and durability at the same time but his kit is completely fune

ekko:  he became fairly decent after they nerfed his absurd damage and the reliability of his kit

akali:  true stealth should not exist

I really don't want to list all of the issues wrong with zoe, it took forever just to go through the champions that don't really have issues in your list but instead it's more the balance and gameplay team's problem

You do not even have to go over the issues with Zoe since there are none. She is as toxic as any champion that has any form of burst. She even has several counters I can think from the top of my head.
{{champion:238}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:145}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:50}} and the list can go one.
It is the same issue I have with people calling out Akali and her "True Stealth." I do not know if I have mentioned it before, but there is something called wait it out. Akali's SHROUD stays for 3 seconds and is a 17-second cooldown. Pick, {{champion:142}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:4}} or {{champion:268}}. If she has her ult, try to make her use it as an escape. If you find her healing a pain, buy {{item:3165}} if your AP or {{item:3033}} if your AD. Buying a {{item:3157}} will also help, same goes for {{item:2033}}. {{item:2033}} is good because it can give you health, mana, and it burns your opponent.
Akali is mobile, but getting a CC or an assassin type champion can deal with her. 

Zoe, you need burst or CC. {{champion:105}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:90}} or {{champion:157}}.
Make sure to stay in cover if you are a mage, or walk closer to her if you are an assassin. Her Q does damage by range, limiting her range or her ways to target you, will make a difference. Someone like {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}} or {{champion:105}} are champions that are able to reach her, by still being Melee. If you want both of good worlds, distance, burst, CC. {{champion:133}} is your best friend in this matchup.
If her E is bothering you, buy {{item:3102}}. I do not understand how people are so mad about her E since this item exist. Getting {{summoner:1}} will also serve as a good counter towards her E, same with her W since she will not be using it for much. Going Spell Book on some mid lane mages would also do good. You also need to, ward. The whole map may not sparkle, but it will surely help you.

Zoe's burst damage is the hardest to implement, unlike many other burst champions.

Then there is the fact that, idiots like the one I replied to, are angry over a fucking 20 Dmg increase and a 2-second difference on her Q and E at LEVEL FUCKING 5. That is pathetic at best. This will not turn her to a monster, nor will it make her go over the 51% WR mark. The fact that people are mad is ridiculous and shows how out of hand some players are. Yes, the B Teams has done crazy shit, but this is far from even crazy. At the moment I think they are doing a much better job than before.

> It is the same issue I have with people calling out Akali and her "True Stealth." I do not know if I have mentioned it before, but there is something called wait it out. Akali's SHROUD stays for 3 seconds and is a 17-second cooldown. 

This is completely false, it lasts 5 seconds, and goes up to 7 at max rank. People are justified calling out a champ who can stay stealthed longer than Kha'Zix with his evolved R using a regular ability, not to mention you can't even counter pick her because she's immune to true sight. Oh, and the cooldown is just 11 seconds at max rank not counting CDR.

?????????????
I doubled checked, yes, it is 6-second. Bravo.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}} 
3 second off, and it makes everything I wrote, pointless. 

The shroud is the second ability maxed. I take it last, but that is whatever.

Oh no, you do not, Kha'Zix gets extra movement speed and can roam with his Ult. Akali is limited to her circle alone. Plus, the Dusk Blade can be proked three times with Kha. Akali will not be able to do that. Unless if you terrible and stay in her zone through the whole duration.

Again, {{item:3157}} is at your despotal. Use it.

> Oh no, you do not, Kha'Zix gets extra movement speed and can roam with his Ult. Akali is limited to her circle alone. Plus, the Dusk Blade can be proked three times with Kha. Akali will not be able to do that. Unless if you terrible and stay in her zone through the whole duration.
> 
> Again, {{item:3157}} is at your despotal. Use it.

Um, yes, Akali gets bonus move speed while in her shroud. The same amount as Kha'Zix's ult when it's maxed actually. And sure, you can't move away from it, but the smoke circle lets you control an area for that time and anyone who goes near it is as good as dead. It makes Akali extremely strong at contesting objectives. If you want the Drake or Baron the enemy team is getting then you will have to enter that circle of death for most of if not its entire duration. 

Zhonya's is far more effective against Kha'Zix because when he emerges from stealth he needs to wait a bit before being able to use it again and is left vulnerable. Even if you CC Akali she will re-enter her shroud so long as she's standing in it, and her Q has a base 1.5 second CD so Zhonya's will only really help against her ult, but if she uses it your health is likely low and she'll kill you anyways.

I do not care at this point. I have played, both as and against, Akali. I have seen clips, from highly skilled players, losing and winning as Akali. I have studied her counters, weakness, strengths, and build paths. The W is, I repeat, not the most OP stealth ability in the game. If you want "strong" stealth, Shaco is probably the closest to OP stealth. He is unseen, can blink over walls, gains extra damage, and he does not have an area he must stay in. Do I think he is broken? Fuck no. But he is annoying.
{{item:3157}} counter ANY burst Assassin, and a lot of other types, the fact that you say, "Akali is the only exception" tells a lot of your game knowledge.
Akali cannot 1v5 thanks to the shroud, she needs her team, especially if she wants to contest. Having one good CC tank or burst champion, like Leona, Galio, Zoe, or Yasuo will fuck her life up. She is still targetable in her Shroud.

As I have said, at it the same goes for Zoe, people are only mad at CT. All the hate posts can easily be debunked with a few tips, they are all strawman arguments. I have already debunked this post, your post, and many more about Zoe and Akali.
I am sorry to say this, but you are wrong. I have already told you from top to bottom how you can beat Zoe and Akali, that comes from my experience, and watching high-level experience. Nothing you have written so far has given me a reason to believe you or take you seriously. Looking at your level you must be playing the game, unlike some other person that I will not be answering to since I will be repeating myself.

I would suggest, trying out Akali and see for yourself. Knowing how to play a champion, will make you better against the champion. That is why Zoe is least of anyone's problem since no one seems to try to understand how she works.

Anyway, we can go on for years. If you agree, we end on that note, if you do not, agree to disagree.

> [{quoted}](name=HyperTechno,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=000200000001000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-26T14:13:32.828+0000)
>
> I do not care at this point. I have played, both as and against, Akali. I have seen clips, from highly skilled players, losing and winning as Akali. I have studied her counters, weakness, strengths, and build paths. The W is, I repeat, not the most OP stealth ability in the game. If you want "strong" stealth, Shaco is probably the closest to OP stealth. He is unseen, can blink over walls, gains extra damage, and he does not have an area he must stay in. Do I think he is broken? Fuck no. But he is annoying.

That's because while his stealth is strong, his other normal abilities are pretty lack luster.
> {{item:3157}} counter ANY burst Assassin, and a lot of other types, the fact that you say, "Akali is the only exception" tells a lot of your game knowledge.

"It's more effective against Kha'Zix than Akali = Akali is the only burst champ Zhonya's doesn't help against" ???
Nice strawman buddy, I never said any such thing. All I said is it's more effective against Kha'Zix because he actually has periods of vulnerability. Akali is far more mobile and even if you catch her out with CC she'll go into stealth again meaning unless most of your damage is from skillshots you're fucked.

> Akali cannot 1v5 thanks to the shroud, she needs her team, especially if she wants to contest. Having one good CC tank or burst champion, like Leona, Galio, Zoe, or Yasuo will fuck her life up. She is still targetable in her Shroud.

I never said she could 1 v 5, All I said is she's very strong at contesting objectives. CC champs are strong against her, yes, especially if they can re-position her away from her shroud or keep her locked down whenever she exits it. Yasuo isn't one of them though, most of his damage comes from basic attacks and Qs, and unless the Akali is bad and sits right next to him he will never hit a Q on her while her shroud is active.
> 
> As I have said, at it the same goes for Zoe, people are only mad at CT. All the hate posts can easily be debunked with a few tips, they are all strawman arguments. I have already debunked this post, your post, and many more about Zoe and Akali.

No you haven't? You put words in my mouth to say you debunked my argument when I never made those arguments in the first place.

> I would suggest, trying out Akali and see for yourself. Knowing how to play a champion, will make you better against the champion. That is why Zoe is least of anyone's problem since no one seems to try to understand how she works.

I already did to see how busted she is, and maybe play her if she gets the nerfs she rightfully deserves because I make it a policy not to play broken champions like her and Zed. In one of my first games (I think 3rd or 4th) I got a triple kill on enemies who were all behind their base walls with every single inhibitor tower up on my own, escaping with about 60% health. She's completely broken and I can say that from personal experience.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

For starters, let's look at zoe's abilities

* She is a zoning mage at the same time as being a poke mage.  Poke mages deal damage to targets  at a range while being vulnerable close.  Zoning mages keep targets away from an area they designate.  See how this is a problem?

* next, let's look at how she makes it where the opponent is punished for using summoner spells, something so powerful that they are on ridiculous cooldowns only matched by ultimate abilities and even then, those are half the duration in a lot of cases
#in line with this, she can deal three instances of ignite damage that all count as separate damage!

* next, her kit makes use of true damage in high amounts.  She can either gain an ignite from a minion or an opponent, or her E changes a portion of her damage into true damage in the amount of several hundred

* She suffers from the old nidalee problem with an effective range on her Q of about 1400 if she uses her ultimate

* her W passive deals damage for any instance of using a pickup and can be combined with her passive to deal large amounts of targeted damage

* Her W has a 1 second cooldown between uses of arguably the most powerful ability in the game and its only limitation is if the zoe player messes up their play

Next, let's look at her matchups.  she has no real bad matchup and is strong at all phases of the game

* Her primary counters are any champion that can outperform her with macro play, which sets a precedent that she can not be overcome if this fails to happen, or that she needs jungler interference to be handled at all

* she has no mana issues, so is not punished by opponents with sustain.  Although she can not spam easily, her kit is almost free compared to most.  Her ultimate, a double blink with safety attached, only costs her 50 mana and can be used in seconds that are affected by cooldown reduction. The only champion allowed to have that much pressure has been Kassadin, who has been utterly destroyed with nerfs since the dawn of his existence

* with her kit being designed with very few weaknesses, it is up to the zoe to misplay in order to gain an advantage against her and not the opponent to outplay.  Yasuo suffers from the same conditions, both champions control how the opponent plays with little room for interaction


#I think that is more than reasonable to say what is wrong with Zoe

When I read the old Nidalee problem, I stopped reading. Why? It is the dumbest and laziest argument. Already setting the theme of how your comment is going to be, a rant about how you cannot play or play against Zoe, and why you THINK she has no counter. Did you read my full comment? I gave you, not quite, but literally tips and tricks to beat Zoe. Already answering, more than half of your rant.

Q increase in damage by distance, therefor Nidalee. For starters, Nidalee Q, is unstoppable, meaning it will not stop till it hits something or reaches its end. Zoe Q is a double cast spell, which if you warded, would be easy to identify if she cast it or not. Secondly, Zoe must be in range for it to travel longer, which can or will get her out of position. You gain damage by, risking your position. Nidalee has the luxury of not needing to.
Make the two abilities hilariously different from many perspectives. Bad argument.

Here is the last comment since you TL/DR it.

Zoe, you need burst or CC. {{champion:105}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:90}} or {{champion:157}}.
Make sure to stay in cover if you are a mage, or walk closer to her if you are an assassin. Her Q does damage by range, limiting her range or her ways to target you, will make a difference. Someone like {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}} or {{champion:105}} are champions that are able to reach her, by still being Melee. If you want both of good worlds, distance, burst, CC. {{champion:133}} is your best friend in this matchup.
If her E is bothering you, buy {{item:3102}}. I do not understand how people are so mad about her E since this item exist. Getting {{summoner:1}} will also serve as a good counter towards her E, same with her W since she will not be using it for much. Going Spell Book on some mid lane mages would also do good. You also need to, ward. The whole map may not sparkle, but it will surely help you.

Zoe's burst damage is the hardest to implement, unlike many other burst champions.

Then there is the fact that, idiots like the one I replied to, are angry over a fucking 20 Dmg increase and a 2-second difference on her Q and E at LEVEL FUCKING 5. That is pathetic at best. This will not turn her to a monster, nor will it make her go over the 51% WR mark. The fact that people are mad is ridiculous and shows how out of hand some players are. Yes, the B Teams has done crazy shit, but this is far from even crazy. At the moment I think they are doing a much better job than before.

This ridiculous, at this point I want Riot to give you idiots the middle finger and revered her back to her old self. Then, oh, you will have fun kid. I remember when she was released, yeah, she was oppressive as fuck. Now you have to be a legit pro or a main of hers to even do good with her. 

> she has no mana issues, so is not punished by opponents with sustain. Although she can not spam easily, her kit is almost free compared to most. Her ultimate, a double blink with safety attached, only costs her 50 mana and can be used in seconds that are affected by cooldown reduction. The only champion allowed to have that much pressure has been Kassadin, who has been utterly destroyed with nerfs since the dawn of his existence.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}} 

Wow, yeah, great. Who has played more than 165 games of Zoe? I have. Have I encountered mana problems with her? Yes. Why? I have to spam my Q to farm, else it will push up towards me. What about the passive? Hey dipshit, I have to use my abilities to use it.

Is
> The only champion allowed to have that much pressure has been Kassadin, who has been utterly destroyed with nerfs since the dawn of his existence.

bullshit? Yes. {{champion:90}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:101}} and {{champion:157}}. 

I also to a look on your account. Keep speaking shit about a champion you do not play, except you do not play in the first place. I know you are trolling at this point because no idiot would be dumb enough to use the Nidalee BS talking point, and be speaking like a know it all when they have zero games played on their account.

should I justify myself to a hypocrite who dismissed my entire post based on a valid argument?  Nidalee was nerfed repeatedly for being able to do almost 2000 damage on a single, low cooldown ability with long range, which Zoe can do similar amounts to with a larger hit radius and more utility in her kit.  425 + 1.5 AP value max.  Even on a basic build of about 600 AP, that's 1325 damage and gets higher on a 6.5 cooldown ability compared to nidalee's 6.0

you seem to have missed how zoe's ability works involving her warp to increase her effective range for it without leaving her out of position due to the nature of her warp

let's take a look at your list of counters.  Pretty much every champion except yasuo focuses on macro play by being more useful to their team than zoe. 
 
* Fizz's main job is to basically shut down one lane and be a consistent threat thereafter.  

* Twisted fate falls off like a rock if his main purpose is not accomplished:  snowballing the other lanes to success. 
 
* zed functions similar to fizz but is a bit more versatile because of his AD kit

* Xerath can play as a lane bully and is all around useful.  He's average in most regards except his range, but he focuses on being useful to his team while requiring micro plays with his awkward Q and R skills

* Yasuo punishes zoe in the same way that she punishes everyone else.  He controls the interactions his laner can accomplish and scales well if the game does not shut down fast...

By the way, ad-hominem is the worst way to progress a debate.  You would for instance have no way of knowing that I keep up with the game but I am unable to play it because our internet service provider discontinued service in our area because the price of maintenance and service was not worth the investment

next time, try not insulting someone when you have a 36% winrate in silver 5 while you primarily play aram...

Hey now, {{champion:28}} just got nerfed

- dmg removed on E, Ult and Dark Harvest

> [{quoted}](name=Hexs Fortune,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2018-10-23T00:21:21.746+0000)
>
> Hey now, {{champion:28}} just got nerfed
> 
> - dmg removed on E, Ult and Dark Harvest

I know. As I said, "better than others." But he hates burst champions, and Eve is in that category. Meaning he wants her gutted further, which I strictly disagree on because then she will be gone from the game. She may hold a 51% WR, but that is thanks to her mains and the pros who play her. Same goes for Zoe, who is barely useable, unless if you are a main or pro.

> [{quoted}](name=HyperTechno,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2018-10-23T00:16:18.047+0000)

Zoe main in the building guys.

I think I finally found what's worse than a Yasuo main.

> [{quoted}](name=Breezy Boyy,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=000200000001000100000000,timestamp=2018-10-23T03:05:27.601+0000)
>
> I think I finally found what's worse than a Yasuo main.

I think I found a biased hater.
Yeah I would rather deal with {{champion:142}} over this bullshit cancer {{champion:7}} any day of the week.
Ezreal is bottom tier why the Fuck is he even there

> [{quoted}](name=maxotyi,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=FG361gI5,comment-id=0002000000010006,timestamp=2018-10-24T01:35:27.491+0000)
>
> Ezreal is bottom tier why the Fuck is he even there

His new W kinda counts as burst, and since the guy, I replied to, said he hates being bursted or 1 to 0'ed. I gave him 22 champions Riot should gut as well because those champions can burst or 1 to 0 you. I did not say, gut them, I said, then you are saying Riot should nerf all of those champions because they are cancer. I love Ezreal, though I wish his attitude could be a bit different, that is just me. Else, yes he is in the bottom, and his buffs are well deserved.

I must have written something that has given the wrong impression then.

Nocturne is an utter trash champion if you understand how easy his kit is to beat and how easy it is to counter him. Unfortunately the way to counter him is to get better map awareness and actually have a tank, CC comp with damage on your team. That just rarely happens. If you block his fear, he is completely useless and will lose against a lot of champions. 

I'm not even going to bring up the fact you're saying to gut lux and cho Gath. Wouldn't be surprised if you failed to listen to rationality, you seem spiked on something.

He said that, not me. I have no problem with any of the champions listed. They were set as an example to call out his questionable ideology. He hates burst champions or champions that can 1 to 0 you. I understand how to deal with burst champions, and I even created two ways you can counter your two most hated champions. {{champion:142}} and {{champion:84}}.
